bibl.title: Archives and Dossiers.
bibl.note: Terminological Issues: The Term Archive in Papyrological Jargon; - Archive versus Library, Archive versus Dossier. - Intact and Mixed Archives: Archives in Their Original Deposit; - Archives Mixed Up in Antiquity; - Archives Mixed Up in Recent Times. - Reconstruction of Archives: Relying on the Archaeological Context: A Solid Method; - Studying Prosopographical Data: A Successful Approach; - Identifying Real Estate: A Method Rarely Applied; - Museum Archaeology: A New Method. - Editions, Guides, and Lists of Archives: Editions; - Guides; - Descriptions, Lists and Studies of Archives. - Types of Archives and Archive Keepers: Official Archives and Personal Archives of Official; - Personal and Family Archives of a Private Nature (Personal versus Family Archives; - Private versus Professional Papers); - Archives of Communities; - Archives Comprising a Single Type of Document. - Composition of Archives: Incoming versus Outgoing Documents; - Juridical versus Sentimental Value. - Greek, Egyptian, and Bilingual Archives. - Classifying Papers and Files. - Ostraca Groups: Archives Sui Generis. - Moments of Joy. - Archives Mentioned in This Chapter, Listed Alphabetically.
R.S. BAGNALL (Ed.), The Oxford Handbook of Papyrology (Oxford, 2009) pp. 216-255, 12 figg.
